item.title: Day 121: Technology Projection
item.description: According to Wikipedia, ‘Power Projection’ is a term used in military and political science to refer to the capacity of a state to deploy and sustain forces outside its territory. This ability is a crucial element of a state’s power in international relations. I think one can use the similar term ‘Technology Projection’ to describe the capacity of an innovative enterprise to deploy and sustain new technology outside their control.

item.title: Day 107: Blogging with Hugo (Part 1)
item.description: As already mentioned, I decided to migrate to Hugo as blog software. Furthermore now GitHub is hosting my pages instead of Google. Though the first steps were rather simple, my specific requirements created some challenges.

item.title: Day 102: Holding hands
item.description: I spent the complete day in escalation calls. I did not have any stakes in the root causes, but was mostly bus holding hands.

item.title: Day 101: Buying a bicycle
item.description: Buying a bicycle seems to be more difficult than I previously though. Or at least it seems to be more difficult for someone like me.

item.title: Day 100: The Offensive continues
item.description: 100 days are over, but I am still in the home office. And if I read the signs and portents correctly, I also will be for quite some time coming. So I will continue my offensive here.
